quote: The universe is a big place, perhaps the biggest.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: This universe belongs to those who know how to see, feel, and love the beauty of life and the universe.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Believe and achieve with Cosmic Ordering.
author: Stephen Richards,  Cosmic Ordering Connection

quote: In a well-ordered universe...
author: Morgan Matson,  Since You've Been Gone

quote: The universe is a philosophical abyss.
author: Kedar Joshi

quote: Just as heart is a fountain of unspoken words,the universe is a womb of wonder weird worlds.
author: Toba Beta

quote: You tap in to this oneness and become part of the universe as a whole.
author: Stephen Richards,  Cosmic Ordering Guide

quote: There’s the impossible and then there’s Cosmic Ordering.
author: Stephen Richards,  Cosmic Ordering Guide

quote: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Our imagination is bigger than this universe.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The universe is inside you; you are the cosmic power.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Every human being is a reflection of this universe.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The greatest mystery the universe offers is not life but Size.
author: Stephen King,  The Gunslinger

quote: What might have been can be with Cosmic Ordering.
author: Stephen Richards,  Cosmic Ordering: You can be successful

quote: You are an Universe of Universes and your soul a source of songs.
author: Rubén Darío

quote: The entire universe has been neatly divided into things to (a) mate with, (b) eat, (c) run away from, and (d) rocks.
author: Terry Pratchett,  Equal Rites

quote: The universe is a million billion light-years wide, and every inch of it would kill you if you went there. This is the position of the universe with regards to human life.
author: Martin Amis

quote: Living threads more numerous than stars frame the universe of my mind.
author: Daniel P. Kimble

quote: The universe is made up of stories, not atoms.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: The universe is big. It's vast and complicated and ridiculous. And sometimes—very rarely—impossible things just happen and we call them miracles.
author: Steven Moffat

quote: Everything existing in the universe is the fruit of chance and necessity.
author: Democritus

quote: There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened.
author: Douglas Adams,  The Restaurant at the End of the Universe

quote: The universe is big, its vast and complicated, and ridiculous. And sometimes, very rarely, impossible things just happen and we call them miracles. And that's the theory. Nine hundred years, never seen one yet, but this would do me.
author: Steven Moffat

quote: Closed in a room, my imagination becomes the universe, and the rest of the world is missing out.
author: Criss Jami,  Diotima, Battery, Electric Personality

quote: There’s as many atoms in a single molecule of your DNA as there are stars in the typical galaxy. We are, each of us, a little universe.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson,  Cosmos

quote: The basic idea is that all things in the universe are intertwined.
author: Stephen Richards,  Cosmic Ordering Guide

quote: You are the creator of your universe, and you are the destroyer of it too.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Each being in the universe yearns for the free energy necessary for survival and development. Each existence resists extinction. The consequent history of violence in the universe is as inevitable as the gravitational pull between the Earth and the Sun.
author: Brian Swimme,  The Universe Story: From the Primordial Flaring Forth to the Ecozoic Era--A Celebration of the Unfol

quote: Our heaven is their hell, said God. I like a balanced universe.
author: Margaret Atwood,  The Tent

quote: The Ultimate Answer to Life, The Universe and Everything is...42!
author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quote: If you think this Universe is bad, you should see some of the others.
author: Philip K. Dick

quote: The universe is made of stories, not of atoms.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: Not only is the Universe stranger than we think, it is stranger than we can think.
author: Werner Heisenberg,  Across the Frontiers

quote: The time has come to realise that an interpretation of the universe—even a positivist one—remains unsatisfying unless it covers the interior as well as the exterior of things; mind as well as matter. The true physics is that which will, one day, achieve the inclusion of man in his wholeness in a coherent picture of the world.
author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin,  The Phenomenon of Man

quote: We are a way for the cosmos to know itself.
author: Carl Sagan,  Cosmos

quote: Creation "I shake my fist and there's bang.Stars sift like sand through my fingers;each swirl of my wrist a galaxy,every kiss imbued with a bit of me.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: If you can think independently, you are the master of this universe.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The choices we’re working with here are a block universe, where past, present and future all coexist simultaneously and everything has already happened; chaos, where anything can happen and nothing can be predicted because we can’t know all the variables; and a Christian universe in which God made everything and it’s all here for a purpose but we have free will anyway.
author: Audrey Niffenegger,  The Time Traveler's Wife

quote: The Cosmos is all that is or was or ever will be. Our feeblest contemplations of the Cosmos stir us -- there is a tingling in the spine, a catch in the voice, a faint sensation, as if a distant memory, of falling from a height. We know we are approaching the greatest of mysteries.
author: Carl Sagan,  Cosmos

quote: The universe danced towards life. Life was a remarkably common commodity. Anything sufficiently complicated seemed to get cut in for some, in the same way that anything massive enough got a generous helping of gravity. The universe had a definite tendency towards awareness. This suggested a certain subtle cruelty woven into the very fabric of space-time.
author: Terry Pratchett,  Soul Music

quote: We are an impossibility in an impossible universe.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: A thought is a Cosmic Order waiting to happen.
author: Stephen Richards

quote: The Universe Begins and Ends in Us If a telescope could see beyond the edges of the universe,we would see ourselves looking into a telescope trying to see beyond the edges of universe.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: One possibility is: God is nothing but the power of the universe to organize itself.
author: Lee Smolin

quote: The cosmos is within us. We are made of star-stuff. We are a way for the universe to know itself.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Reach for the stars.
author: Christa McAuliffe

quote: The History Of The Universe In Three WordsCHAPTER ONEBang!CHAPTER TWOsssssCHAPTER THREEcrunch.THE END
author: Iain M. Banks

quote: And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.
author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

quote: Defeat the warriors of patience and time with Cosmic Ordering.
author: Stephen Richards,  Cosmic Ordering: You can be successful

quote: The key to failure is ignoring Cosmic Ordering.
author: Stephen Richards
